Reviews.Title: “great!!!”
Reviews.Author: ras81
Reviews.Content: really great hotel, big and clean rooms, with all just all u need including free wifi. the staff is very friendly and the location is excelent

Reviews.Title: “This place looked like a third world abortion clinic:”
Reviews.Author: Lucas A
Reviews.Content: Any positive reviews on this hotel are fake. The floor had crumbs and hair on it. The pillow had pubic hair on it. The outlets and light switch panels where smudged. Curtains had crusties on them. The walls looked like they had sees a few first-grader booger fights. The headboard had suspicious white crust. The lampshade had smudges on it. The couch and curtains had crusties on them. There was food and hair under the bed. The doors had smudges on them. The showerhead was one of those crappy massage showerheads, and it was stuck on a massage setting. The connection of the showerhead leaked and sprayed water to the side. There was an incessant humming in the room. The rooms were dark. The molding was broken. The plastic rings around the elevator buttons were broken. The floors were grimy. The outlets were so old and loose that my Mac charger would fall out. The one soda machine was out of water and more than half of the other beverages, and it had a piece of paper taped to it saying that beverages cost $2. There was no fitness room as advertised, instead it looks like they were using the room to store mattresses--a possible sign that they are dealing with bed bugs. The tile was broken. The tinting on the widows was torn and partially missing. There was no carpet in the downstairs hallway. The ‘business center’ was two crappy mismatching chairs, a few brochures, and a hanging power strip. Also, the one person working there sent me to an occupied room where another lodger was watching TV. I slept on top of the sheets with the lights on in hopes of keeping away bed bugs. This place is currently rated as a 2.5-star hotel and costs a typical $110 - $140, but that is not even close to an accurate star rating. Unless you are looking for an inexpensive place to kill yourself, do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy to sleep”
Reviews.Author: swingspan
Reviews.Content: Checked into the room, which was a bit shabby. Sorely in need of renovation. The toilet flushing mechanism broke twice on my stay, and the staff only fixed it grudgingly. But here's the kicker: at 3 a.m., when I went to the desk to inquire about the pounding music, I got this: "Oh, that's on the 8th floor. Surprised you can hear it, no one else by you complained." No apology. No move to another room. No nothing. I'm checking out early in the morning. Won't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not such a great value, location misleading”
Reviews.Author: budgetfreak
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel according to Expedia and Google Maps is within 3-4 blocks of the Arizona Center. This is NOT the case. It's actually about 15 long Phoenix blocks from AZ center. But that is not the main reason I'm giving the hotel a poor rating. The hotel is not really maintained well. The electrical outlets were grimy and somewhat scary. My colleague complained to me about hearing the person upstairs taking a pee. The continental breakfast should be skipped altogether. The front desk clerk recommended a cafe with only sandwiches for dinner when we asked for a proper restaurant. On the bright side, the bed was clean and the wi-fi worked ok. The pillows were way too hard. We paid $99/night using Expedia, but there are likely cheaper hotels for the same quality and same distance from downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Good price and location”
Reviews.Author: st_mike407
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine was having a show of his work at an art gallery in downtown Phoenix. I wanted to find a hotel that was centrally located and near the gallery. I chose the Lexington mainly for location and price. When I called the hotel to find out about getting there from the airport, I got very thorough information about the light rail. There is a light rail stop almost in front of the hotel, which made it very convenient. The hotel itself was average in terms of looks. My room was a good size, with a king size bed and a desk to work at. The wifi was pretty reliable, although I got better reception with my iPhone than my laptop. The bed was quite nice. There is a decent complimentary breakfast at the lobby restaurant. The walls of the restaurant are painted with blackboard paint, and there is chalk provided so guests can add notes or artwork to the wall. There is also a small gallery in one hall of the hotel featuring what I assumed to be local artists. The Lexington is located in what is called the "arts district" of Phoenix. It is a short walk to the museum and to Roosevelt Row, where there is a collection of art galleries, artist studios, tattoo shops, and hipster cafes. It is also a short walk to downtown, where there are some decent restaurants and a movie theater. This was a pleasant surprise as we didn't want to have to drive everywhere. Overall a pleasant surprise in terms of location and room quality.

Reviews.Title: “Pictures look better than it is”
Reviews.Author: kpayton
Reviews.Content: Although they did change our room after our request, some of the room are just completely old and run down and smoky. Some of the rooms do offer great views of downtown. It's location is the best thing going for it. I wouldn't book just based on pictures online. If you want to stay here, go there, see the rooms, and pick out the room you want. They have a loyalty program you can join so you get a discount on the room. They have a small pool and outdoor hot tub. They have recently tried to re-invent themselves some. I only have seen new signs for cycle - the bar at the hotel. I have also seen advertisements for concerts or brunch by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the price”
Reviews.Author: Davefromwis
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of an Orbitz travel package. For the price, of around 30 something a night, it was better than expected. Location isn't too bad. It's across from the light rail but it wasn't too loud. Area not too bad, but you need to use common sense about walking around the area at night. The hotel is older but in decent shape for its age. Only complaint about the room is that the window only has a sheer curtain so you cannot block out the light at all; only other problem was thin walls. It sounded like some guy was urinating in my bathroom, the sound traveled so well--kinda strange. The room was pretty big with a king size bed, large desk, sofa, coffee table, and easy chair--practically a suite. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Who writes the reviews?????”
Reviews.Author: susiegChinoValleyAz
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay in Phx because I live about 2 miles north and did not want to drive home after a Diamondbacks game. All downtown hotels were way expensive, I found the Lexington and it was near the light rail to take downtown, and was considerably cheaper. Reviews on one travel site were not bad, and having lived in Phoenix a good part of my life, I knew the area and decided to stay here. Well, the staff was nice, the room was large...that's where it ends. The room was large, but I would not have sat in the overstuffed armchair in that room for anything. The carpet was badly stained, beds felt like you were sleeping on box springs and practically on the floor!!! Rooms very stark, bathroom was ok if you didn't look at the a/c vent. I really didn't want to stay there but didn't want to move at 10:00 pm either. I already paid, and oh yeah, they "authorize" your credit card for an extra $50 that they refund to your account when you leave.....there isn't $50 worth of anything I would want in that hotel. When I checked out and told them what I thought, they said it would start being refurbished at the end of the year. Until that happens, never again....cheaper for a reason.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest staff ever!”
Reviews.Author: sara e
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We came as a large group, so things could have been very complicated. But the staff were so friendly and flexible- they made it all easy! The breakfast in the morning was great, and the location was convenient if you had a light rail pass. There's a station just outside the front door! I recommend this to anyone looking for a great hotel at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel i ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: martha31230
Reviews.Content: Bathroom doors didnt lock, they had false adverstment there was no gym room at this location, the hottest rooms- AC units didnt work well the room was at 82 degrees after having the AC on for 4 hours unable to sleep. staff didnt do anything about it! i try contacting the manager it took her 8 days to call back and said she could do anything about it never staying at this location ever again it was a nightmare

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed”
Reviews.Author: Notrub00
Reviews.Content: Kudos to the front desk staff. They were so cool and always happy! We actually experienced two different rooms at this hotel. The first, room 507 was not clean (didn't want to touch anything in the room). However, due to a safe malfunction we were placed in room 710, a much cleaner room with a view of downtown. Enjoyed Belgian waffles for breakfast every day.

Reviews.Title: “DISAPPOINTING”
Reviews.Author: tg1437
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed at a hotel where the staff lacked in personality, seemed they just were not there to greet with a smile, in fact no one smiled. I had to come down to get extra towels and they said sorry we don't have any we will get you some, I waited and was forgotten about I came down and had to ask again. Then asked the front desk to set a wake up call for me that was never set in fact! I've stayed at this hotel before and remember a nice woman, I think her name was Christine and she always asked if she could get me anything, asked if my stay was ok, always greeted me with a smile and alertness, I always felt that she cared. I asked the front desk the next morning about her and I was told she was let go. Let go?! A worker who had genuine care from within. I will never stay at the Lexington Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive and safe.”
Reviews.Author: travelsalot35
Reviews.Content: We wanted an inexpensive and central hotel in Phoenix and this hotel fit that description. The decor is dated, the walls are hospital green and a good cleaning would help but the hotel was safe, inexpensive and in a good location. The beds could be replaced as they don't have any support left but the room was large. The staff was excellent - very friendly and helpful - from the front desk to the bartender.

Reviews.Title: “Molding the bathrrom, brick hard bed, stains on floor, never again”
Reviews.Author: travel201120001
Reviews.Content: I will not at a this hotel again, I have done alot of travel in my day and stayed at a number of different hotels and the second I got in to my room at Lexington I wanted to checkout. While i understand many hotels can['t afford remodels at this time at least take pride and take care of what you have an provide a clean area for your guests. The bathroom had mold growing on the tiles, water would go from hot to cold with out any adjustment and the stains on the carpet were gross. The bed was harder that the floor. I would not recommend this place to anyone. To bad it was my 10 yrs wedding and anniversy and this is what I will remember.if you are looking at this hotel for location there are other hotels in better condition and with friendlier staff. Marriot, Sherton are close by and around the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the "free" breakfast”
Reviews.Author: JudesDad
Reviews.Content: i stayed here on a business trip. I selected it because of the location, close to downtown and light rail and value relative to other hotels in the area. The room was OK, staff was pleasant, my problem was with the breakfast. I am a frequent business traveler used to "free" food being worth the cost. This was the worst I can remember. The bagel was stale, the boiled egg dry and there was black bits floating in the OJ. Uggh, still makes me shudder. This was on a Monday morning so I may have gotten the bits leftover from the weekend (I didn't give it a second go).

Reviews.Title: “Stay WELL clear of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: EnglishShmanny
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I arrived on the 26th October having flown in from the UK. We asked where the restaurant was and were told "we do not have a restaurant, we had to close it down and re-furbish the whole kitchen" ...so tired and hungry we asked where we could get a quick meal and were told " I don't know, I'm not from these parts"! Our first rooms were dirty, my sofa was clearly broken and my colleagues room smelt of mould. So we changed our rooms and were given a junior suite at no extra charge. We were assured breakfast would be a "a range of cereals and pastries + plus coffee etc" . I woke up at 3 am in the morning to hear my neighbour chatting on his phone as the walls were paper thin and the room again smelt so badly of mould that I was wheezing......so I changed again. Later my colleague and I went down for breakfast only to discover that breakfast was 'a muffin' .....nothing else!!!!!. We asked for a drink of water and were told "we do not have water"! On asking the staff to show us the gym, one smiled and said "well that's a kind of a joke........he was right.......needless to say we checked out and moved to the Hyatt.... This hotel, we were informed on arrival had just gone through a bankruptcy and was being 're-furbished' .....my advice would be to knock it down and start afresh....DO NOT BELIEVE THE PICTURES ON ANY OF THE WEBSITES RE THIS HOTEL......THEY ARE EXTREMELY MISLEADING.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Location”
Reviews.Author: CoachJames
Reviews.Content: I presented at a seminar at the Phx convention center and the hotels right at the door of the convention center were very upscale and expensive. I found the Lexington just down the street and hopped the train which was right out front of the hotel. The hotel is older but was clean and that staff was fantastic. On my arrival night i was too tired to venture out downtown so I ate in the restaurant and the chef actually came out to talk with me. I ordered chicken alfredo and it was great!! He said he was new and had just redone the restaurant and menus and it was great. The building is a little tired and in need of some renovations, but for the price, location and service i recieved this is where I will stay when I am in downtown phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive choice in downtown area”
Reviews.Author: GPsy
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty basic place, but the rooms are large and there is an outdoor pool and hot tub. Maintenance is below average. The continental breakfast is minimal. But the price is often very good and we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel in Central Location”
Reviews.Author: gavmonk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lexington with my 15-year-old son when we visited Phoenix for Wrestlemania. The hotel was in a very convenient position right opposite the Metro Light Rail Station, which made the transfer from the airport so simple. The Hotel staff were very helpful and friendly, there was no problem booking extra nights with them as we were caught up in the BA strike. I think the only criticism of the staff would be that they didn't know much about the local area. Rooms were well equipped and clean, but hallways could do with a little updating. The only negative we found was the food in the hotels bar, I would definitely avoid if we returned, there were plenty of restaurants in Downtown Phoenix that were a lot better quality and better value. This Hotel was great value for money and I would definitely recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Barely OK”
Reviews.Author: cuatmission
Reviews.Content: This hotel is tired. I think with the location it could be wonderful if someone were to come in and remodel the whole thing. Carpet is worn & dirty on my 3rd floor room. Low wattage bulbs make it a dim room. The decor in my room was total mis-match of furniture. You get the idea. For $90 I could have stayed somewhere Fun and Exciting out in Scottsdale. Next time I will.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly and Unclean”
Reviews.Author: savvytraveler52
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 3 nights in this hotel. We were VERY DISAPPOINTED with the service, cleanliness and staff. Our room # was 305 and the carpeting was in need of repair and cleaning. There is a 3.5 inch of black dirt / dust beginning at the base board. Looks like the staff hasn't vacuumed up to the base board for about 4-5 months. We walked through the lobby on 3 different days and NO ONE acknowledged us. It is good business / customer service to acknowledge your guests. We called the front desk on two occasions - one to ask for late check out and also to inquire about the hotel shuttle and was told "call back tomorrow" I don't think we can help you. I will not recommend your hotels. The Phoenix location needs a thorough cleaning top to bottom.

Reviews.Title: “This Phoenix Hotel Isn't Rising”
Reviews.Author: shanbo5150
Reviews.Content: Clearly a hotel that has seen better days, it offers very affordable and centrally located accommodation for the night, near excellent eclectic nightlife, and the light rail system. There is a restaurant and bar, that on the nights I stayed were of such low standard, I eventually took my money down the street to eat and drink. Seated at the bar, I managed to order a drink before the obviously harried woman overwhelmed with her multi-tasking rushed off with a series of food trays for an age. The menu is sparse to say the least. Another guest and I were both advised that what we wanted was unavailable when she finally returned... you'll never be accused of drinking excessively here, due to the wait time between service and the likelihood that you'll be handed your tab after two as I was. I tipped the woman well, because I felt she was being unfairly expected to perform jobs that should require at least two other people. The rooms are relatively clean, but my room had no 'do not disturb sign'.. I later discovered from other guests that this was true of their rooms too... If you like to sleep in, remember room service gets cracking at 9:15 AM.

Reviews.Title: “Lexington Phoenix Now in Bankruptcy”
Reviews.Author: flyiowa
Reviews.Content: The room was a great deal, but I found out while I was there that the hotel is in bankruptcy. I reserved a penthouse suite with my family and needed an extra pillow, there are NONE!! They actually had to go into a non-reserved room to get a pillow for my daughter. Location is great, but I would be VERY cautious of pre-paying for a room....

Reviews.Title: “Not the tops but good value for money and great location”
Reviews.Author: Colinfw
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in Feb 2010 on the sixth floor. Rooms are fine. This is an older property and carpets, etc, show some wear but everything worked for me. Location is fantastic with a rapid transit stop to downtown and the airport right outside the door (Roosevelt station). You need the transit because the hotel is not located in an interesting area - not even any interesting restaurants close by and there is not much shopping in downtown Phoenix, but the train is fast and frequent and can get you to many more interesting neighborhoods. I was attending the Phoenix Convention Center and with the train and a short walk I could easily be back and forth in 15 minutes each way. The continental breakfast is a bit sparse but if all you need is coffee and juice and a slice of toast or a choice of two or three cereals it will do. No one in Phoenix knows where the Lexington is - apparently it used to be a Best Western and is still shown on transit maps and known by many under that name. Glass wall elevator has good view over the downtown area, if only there were much to see there!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KaliMau
Reviews.Content: A few of us booked two rooms at the Lexington for New Year's Eve. If you can get a good rate on this hotel, book it. If you're looking for something more botique-ey, then go up the road to the Clarendon. The hotel is clean and comfortable for the cost. The location to the light rail makes it convenient. The hotel is a bit dated and depending on the season, I'd check on how they are running their climate control. Our room was hot, but were informed that the hotel had switched to heat from A/C and we were unable to really control our temp. Ben, on the front desk at night, was a big help. The suites are very large and nice for having people over before a drink. The breakfast does suck. Head over to Matt's Big Breakfast if you want something hearty. A good cup of coffee can be had in walking distance to Fair Trade.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected maintenance problem? More likely OVERBOOKED”
Reviews.Author: CTYankeesFan
Reviews.Content: Like the another reviewer, I was bumped from my stay for a tradeshow in town due to a "plumbing problem" that just cropped up that morning. Of the two desk attendants, one seemed to be mildly sorry but the other pretty much couldn't care less about the inconvenience. My boss later overheard someone say it was just code for the fact that they overbooked. We couldn't afford to wait for their free shuttle to the Quality Suites in Tempe, so we got saddled with a hefty cab fare to get there. Had we been able to stay at the conveniently located Lexington, it would have meant a 1-mile, $1.75 trip to and from the Convention Center on the light rail. Instead, we were stuck with a $25-$50 cab fare EACH WAY every day. What a joke.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, awful, awful - ruined my trip”
Reviews.Author: choadie26
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at the Lexington Hotel, I was informed that there was an "unexpected maintenance issue", that they'd had to book me at a room at their sister hotel, and that a shuttle would whisk me over to the new hotel. Okay, no worries, I thought - minor inconvenience. Two hours later, the shuttle pulled up. TWO HOURS! And when the driver informed us that the new hotel was more than 30 minutes away in Tempe, I was furious. I'd booked the Lexington for the sole reason that it was near the Convention Center, where I was attending a trade show. Finally, the shuttle dropped me (and a few other unlucky souls) off at the "sister hotel", a dirty, sketchy Quality Suites. There was no offer to compensate us for our inconvenience, no communication during the wait for the shuttle, and the whole situation was generally handled unsatisfactorily. Why couldn't they have informed their guests prior to arrival about their issue, so I could've got my money back and made alternate arrangements to stay near the convention center? The shuttle driver said "this type of maintenance problem happens all the time", so if I were you, I would NOT take my chances with this terrible hotel, and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: italyfan98
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a good choice for Phoenix. Very clean and comfortable rooms. Breakfast was ok. Staff were not overly helpful but pleasant enough. The location was very central and the hotel had lots of information for things to see and do in Phoenix. My only problem with the hotel was the fact that the website seemed to promise free internet access in each room (laptop included) but this was not the case. There was free internet access in the lobby/business centre of the hotel. But i really think it should be made more clear on the hotels website.

Reviews.Title: “Lexington Hotel Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: zumpy
Reviews.Content: On a recent touring holiday of California we had the misfortune to have to stay at the Lexington. A very smelly room, which felt and looked as if it had not been occupied for ages. The bathroom sink was blocked or so it seemed. Horrible smells and sights were eminating from the sink. The door to the outside of the room lead to the pool area of the hotel, this door was very awkward to open. The breakfast the following morning was very meagre. Polystyrene bowls for cereal, the service non existant. This was just one hotel in a string of rather substandard ones on a tour which promised more. Do not visit the Lexington. This hotel needs a good clean, and a refurb.

Reviews.Title: “Not at All Impressed”
Reviews.Author: IFFLY
Reviews.Content: This place was filthy...the bathrooms had hair from previous guests...the pool deck was a mess...the men's bathroom at the pool/fitness room had 13 dead cockroaches from the Sunday we arrived until the Thursday of the following week. Two of the rooms in our party needed to move because the AC didn't work (it was 110 outside). The fitness room was joke to say the least...one old Universal machine and a broken bike. I should have taken photos to post! I tried contacting the management but no reply. Only saving grace is it's location to the Metro Rail.

Reviews.Title: “Pass unless you get a fantastic rate and only need a place to sleep before a flight”
Reviews.Author: BLH613
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night prior to an early morning flight. The location was nice, 10 minutes to the rental car center and airport. However, the room was dated, not as clean as it could have been and the beds uncomfortable. Our room on the fourth floor was extremely warm when we checked in. I didn't think much of this as it was over 100F outside, but it never cooled below 80F even with the A/C on all night. Clearly this hotel has changed hands from Best Western and hasn't been refurbished as it so desperately needs. They didn't even bother to change out the linens, etc. The pillows on the bed still have Best Western tags on them, the pens in the lobby say Best Western, etc. Continental breakfast was coffee, tea, apple juice, bagels, little pastries and packets of oatmeal. If you get a great rate and only need a place to lay your head for a night it's ok, but there are plenty of better places to stay. I should mention that I booked this for $55/nt using a Lexington preferred guest program rate and though I was given that rate at check in, I was denied the benefits of my membership in the preferred guest program (room upgrade, one free pay per view movie) because I didn't have my ID card with me. What hotel rewards program requires you to present the ID card???

Reviews.Title: “Not fancy, just a great little hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: karensclan
Reviews.Content: This was a great experience for me! The hotel is located across the street from the metro which can take you almost anywhere, including the convention center and the airport! Didn't need a rental car!! The staff was so nice...especially Flo and Juan. The room was clean and the food was delicious!! Since I was traveling alone, I wanted to feel safe and i certainly did!! Best deal in town!!

Reviews.Title: “Just ok, nothing to write home about.”
Reviews.Author: cinderella4jc
Reviews.Content: I like that it is a non-smoking hotel to start with. It is a refurburshed Best Western that still needs some help, the over all room was good enough, had a view of the roof below. The carpet was full of dust, but rest of room was ok. I stayed there for one night to pick up my son from ASU downtown campus, it is so close you can see the dorms from your window. Also you can see the light rail and NBC across the street if you have business there it would be great. The free breakfast was the usual, oatmeal, fruit, danishes, coffee, tea and juice. I could not get my coffee maker to work in room, so I ran downstairs and got coffee. Oh the first elevator works well, but the other two the desk manager said were having trouble and people were getting stuck inside, so watch out for that. Other wise I think it is an ok hotel. The rooms are quite big. Parking outside with no over hang, for Phoenix that is hard with the heat.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome customer service”
Reviews.Author: EmberC
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. Parts were a bit dated - especially the low popcorn/panel ceilings. But overall, it was clean and very well maintained. Each room that I saw had a fridge and a microwave. Location was excellent - right on the light rail near the heart of downtown Phoenix. Views from the upper floors were excellent. Elevators were a bit slow, but one had a nice glass wall with a view. The free breakfast was basic, but good. Wireless access was fast, free, and easy to connect to. The hotel could bennefit from one of those binder guides in the room to list things like how to connect to the internet, hours of the free breakfast, and that sort of thing. Value was excellent for the money, especially with the deals you can get online.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: BananaHamock
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay, I dont know what all these other people are talking about, The girl that was there at night was very helpful and wonderful, i think her name was Lacey, and I also appreciate all the help and kind words from Joey the van driver and Ben another front desk person, I had an amazing time

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kaycj
Reviews.Content: I found this to be a very comfortable place to stay for one night. for an excellent rate (I paid about $80). I lucked out and got an exceptional room -- on the top (eighth) floor. The room was large, had a couch and coffee table and a balcony. Only the top-floor rooms have balconies and I don't know if all rooms have couches. The room was very quiet as long as the window (sliding-glass door) was closed. Because the hotel is right on the light-rail route, I could hear some train bells in the morning, but nothing that bothered me. Of course, I had the air conditioning on during the night and it was quite loud and helped to block outside noise. The volume of the AC would really be my only complaint. Note that the hotel had just changed hands when I stayed there, so maybe improvements are on the horizon. My room was immaculately clean, but with aging furniture. You won't find the modern, pillow-top beds or flat-screen TVs here that are popping up elsewhere. But the bed and bathroom linens were quite nice. Location-wise, nothing within walking distance that I could see -- except the light-rail train. But very close to downtown. Felt completely safe there as a woman traveling alone. One thing I noticed, there was no covered parking; not an issue for me in March, but would be a negative for Arizona summers.

Reviews.Title: “Price was right”
Reviews.Author: Peabody
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised at $69 night. Front desk was not helpful, but who cares...for $69 you get a clean, fairly-large room, central air, refrig/micro, free (but sparse) breakfast buffet. Stayed there because it was near Banner Hospital.

Reviews.Title: “Great Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: rjhartless
Reviews.Content: This property has really improved since our last stay. Room was cool, clean and comfy. The restaurant downstairs is the best kept secret in the area! The food and service was outstanding (try the seafood platter). Staff was courteous and efficient. Good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: schmupergirl
Reviews.Content: We had an enjoyable stay at this hotel. We found the free continental breakfast no better/worse than anywhere else. The pool area- while it looked like it could have used some tidying- was very nice and relaxing. Our standard room was very clean and comfy. Our only complaint was the air conditioning. It seemd to run constantly but never bring the temp below 75 in the room. This wouldn't have been a big deal if it weren't 113 out! We did complain and they offered to give us a new room; however, we opted to not move as it would have been too big of a hassle to lug all of our stuff to a different room. If you stay here- ask for a room that is not on the first floor. We stayed on the 6th but i noticed that there is minimal privacy for those in the 1st floor rooms as the windows run along the parking lot., pool, etc. I was glad I didn't stay on the 1st floor. Everyone at this hotel was very nice. With the exception of the air- we had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: LaTOLA
Reviews.Content: The desk person was in a rude mood. There was construction being done on the street in front of the hotel; which made it very difficult driving around. The air conditioner was very loud. Nothing told us that there was a free breakfast - the restaurant looked like it was closed. All in all the price was way too high for such a poor accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “A fair stay for business”
Reviews.Author: AZWiseguy
Reviews.Content: My coworker and I were booked into the BW Central Phoenix for 2 nights. I would describe the experience as fair or average. Features I liked included the continental breakfast, efficient check-in, humble but useful work-out room, and an average room with a good bed. The free high-speed internet was great for email and small productions but slow for graphics-intensive work. It is still a great perk. Because we were on a business trip, I was very leery of giving my credit card for "incidentals." Twice before at other places the front desk has billed my card instead of our purchase order. I spoke to two front desk clerks at check-in and check-out and both of them gave me the evil eye (in my opinion) when I brought this up. They were brief, bordering on rude, but they did ensure that the PO was billed appropriately. I could have done without the attitude. One of the desk clerks, a dark-haired woman with an eastern European accent was very nice to my coworker and knew all about the PO situation with our business. She deserves special recognition. The building appears to be on permanent lock-down, as the only way in is through the front door, away from the main parking area. I respect the need for more security, but what about card readers at the outside doors for guests? Some things future guests here should be aware of: there is construction all along Central Avenue right by the hotel and they are ripping up the road to build a light-rail. This is not the BW's fault, and of course I support the project but it makes it very difficult to actually find your way into the hotel. To get in, find your way to 3rd Ave, which is west of central ave. Then go north about two blocks to Portland street, turn right on Portland, then travel down a street of residential condos. go around the semi-circle at the end of Portland (next to Central) and look for the entrance for the hotel. Consult a street map before you go! At $222 for two nights, I would say that this BW is only a fair value for the price. I would not stay here again at this price on personal business.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, efficient, good value.”
Reviews.Author: ManOfClay
Reviews.Content: We arrived late in the evening due to a delayed flight, and finding this hotel in a car in the dark was not the easiest bit of navigation I have done - I ended up wishing that I had hired the sat-nav with the car. We only stayed 2 nights, but we had a clean and comfy standard room at a good rate, and the staff could not have been more friendly or helpful. Ellie, behind the front desk, made several phone calls and drew lots of maps to help us get to some specific areas of town. The restaurant won't win any michelin stars, but it was convenient. The location is not the best, but we never felt remotely at risk, and I would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are OK, security is not”
Reviews.Author: GMStiles
Reviews.Content: 1. This place is in a fairly tough part of town, which I knew going in. 2. It was the cheapest "nice" hotel close to the convention center which is why I stayed. 3. I got a upgrade to a "suite" because of my GCC status so I don't know how good/bad the "regular" rooms are. My room was fine, nothing fancy and certainly not equal to any Marriott or Hilton property. 4. I paid $136 vs the $199 special rate at the Hyatt for the convention and I though (before getting there) the difference was worth it. 5. One of my fellow conventioneers had their car broken into as well as one other car. He found out that just a few days earlier another car was broken into as well. 6. The parking is outside with no gate or security. 7. When I checked out early I told the front desk I was leaving because of the security and they said "we can't control that WE ARE DOWNTOWN". 8. I think for that high a price for a lowly BW they could afford to have someone watching the lot at night especially in light of the frequent break-ins. 9. The "free" breakfast is nothing more than bagels, juice and waffles. 10. The shuttle to the convention center was $4 and to the airport it was $9. Both are minutes away. I can't remember the last time I paid to use the hotel shuttle and I found it very cheap on the hotels part. 11. Next time I will spend the extra money to keep my car safe.

Reviews.Title: “Convienient Comfortable business travel Hotel”
Reviews.Author: spyrogyra
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay in two months and I have noticed a continuing trend of upgrades and service. Understand the property is under new management and it really shows. Prices are competitive especially against the downtown megaprops who charge you for standing still in one spot too long. Nice little bar and restaurant on site and easy walking distance to trendy bistros (Portland's a really nice hip restaurant is immediately next door.) Recommend this highly for the seasoned Pheonix road warrior or warriorette.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for us”
Reviews.Author: allseeingeye
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight after a very long flight to Phoenix from New England. The hotel is a straight shot from the airport and easy to find. Rail construction in the street out front caused some backtracking, but I assume that is finished by now. Parking is ample, although you do have to walk around to the front entrance after the back door is locked. The hotel has been undergoing renovations, which appeared to be mostly complete. Our room was quite large and spacious, and very comfortable. We ate at the restaurant on premises, as we just wanted to crash after the flight, and it was quite decent. We booked this stay on a web site that offered a VERY good rate considering the excellent room -- I forget how much exactly but I think it was about $80. The hotel was not very busy at that time, and I observed that a walk-in customer who was ahead of me actually got an even lower rate than I did. I imagine rate flexibility depends on what's going on in town, convention business, etc, so you might not find that low a rate all the time. I would try it again, if we do a similar itinerary.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly disappointed, but still a good stay...”
Reviews.Author: CentILMatt
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a baseball game - made reservations at this hotel because of the good rate and close proximity to the Diamondbacks ballpark. The hotel is undergoing renovations - the lobby was OK, but there were signs of construction work throughout the building. New HVAC units were taking up about 8 spots in the parking lot. In addition, there's a new light rail line being constructed right in front of this hotel. As such, traffic was slightly congested and it was hard to get in and out of the hotel property. Front desk staff were very friendly and helpful; made us feel very welcome to their property. Room was very large and accomodating with nice furnishings and clean carpet/bathroom. No complaints at all on the room. Hallways were a little dark with low ceilings. Elevators looked and operated as if they were a little "tired". Maybe they are going to be a part of the renovations as well. BAIT & SWITCH WARNING!!! When we made reservations at this hotel, we were told there was a complementary shuttle to downtown and a free breakfast. Neither held true. We were told that "due to increased costs of operating a shuttle", cost was $4 per person one-way. The breakfast layout had been changed from a free continental breakfast to a $8.99/plate buffet breakfast. Had we known about these 2 things, we quite possibly might have looked at a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably comfortable, but a few misses”
Reviews.Author: ua1953
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights 4/27&28 at this property. Earlier reviews were quite complimentary but we felt painted a little brighter picture than we found. It is an older property with up-grading in process. The lobby area makes a very good impression and the there are three internet sites for use by the guests, good idea!. Everywhere you go inside and out there are two to three steps up or down. Only one cut out was found so if you need wheelchair access I would avoid this hotel. The double room we had was pretty basic and not really in keeping with the "Suite" theme. It was nicly decorated and equipped. The bath had not been upgraded. It was small and all white, and lacked a soapdish in the shower and no grab bars with a rather tricky exit required out of the shower/tub. The breakfast was average despite being called a "hot buffet". The only hot items were scrambled eggs, institution style and some very good hash browns. A sausage or strip of bacon woud have been most welcome. They did offer the opportunity to make your own waffles.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Budthumbs
Reviews.Content: We flew into Phoenix on Saturday. We arrived at the hotel around 5:30 p.m. We checked in, was given our room and to our surprise and theirs, it wasn't clean. A maintenance worker just happened to be there when we found the room in a mess. He immediately contacted the front desk. They were so embarrassed, the owner of the hotel apologized and told us to go into the lounge for dinner and drinks (on him) while we waited for our room to be cleaned. The rest of the stay was excellent. We couldn't have asked for better service. Every morning we had a complimentary continental breakfast, the van was always available, the staff was extremely friendly and the location was perfect. We will stay with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: coaster8
Reviews.Content: Lots of services promised and not provided. The shuttle wasn't running, and the restaurant was closed down - both of those explained to me with "because business is low right now around the holidays." So I guess you should make sure it's going to be busy when you go! The business center has been taken apart - the front desk staff did not know if it was going to be back, since they had no idea it had been taken apart and were quite shocked to find out, when they tried to let me in to use it. Vending machines were out of everything except in the lobby. Staff was very friendly and a bit embarrassed about everything that wasn't available. The room itself was fine. Could be a nice place if they delivered on their promises.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: BeingGreen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the beginning and end of a trip to Arizona so we were here during two differernt weekends. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. I would say they are the best part of the hotel! An elevator was broken during our last stay and it was most annoying, but did not greatly impact the overall experience. We found the place quiet, the complimentary breakfast a notch above some others at similar chain hotels, and the parking adequate. All in all it is a nice and affordable spot for sightseeing in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel and staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was staying in Phoenix on vacation and wanted a great room in the downtown area. This hotel was perfect. Almost every room has an incredible view of the city skyline. My room in particular, overlooked Phoenix's Japanese Gardens, as well as a beautiful park. The hotel offers a free shuttle service that will take you anywhere you need to go within 3 miles. Trust me, there is plenty to do within 3 miles. The shuttle will also take you to the airport. The room itself was extremely clean, and had excellent climate control, which is EXTREMLY important if you are going to be in Phoenix. The pool and Spa are great on a hot day. Also, if you are going to be traveling with children, they receive complimentary Otis Spunkmeier cookies upon check in. The staff here was incredibly friendly too. I had read previous reviews of this hotel before I came and was definitely scared however all of the negative reviews were from before the major renovation/restaffing the hotel undertook last year. As of now, everything in the hotel is practically new. I am definitely going to stay there again if I ever return to Phoenix!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a great time at this hotel and did not experience any of what the bad reviews are about. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the rooms were large and comfortable, the free breakfast was great, and the location downtown was excellent. The free shuttle to and from the airport saved us over 30 dollars alone in taxi cab fare (Phoenix Taxi fares are ridiculously expensive) and is also available anywhere downtown. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in downtown Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Ugh!”
Reviews.Author: Seajack
Reviews.Content: I agree with what others have posted here: the location at night is somewhat seedy, and the folks in the next room were rather noisy. The room itself was okay, though I thought slightly overpriced. Dinner at their restaurant was okay - overall, not bad, not good. Their "free" breakfast offer leaves *a lot* to be desired: a modest plate of scrambled eggs, toast and potatoes ("meat" was $1 extra, no mention of "seconds"). The sign propped on each table reminding diners "tipping NOT included" was tacky. The staff seemed clueless about Best Western frequent stay credit (which was why I chose them in the first place). When I pressed the issue, the clerk printed out a receipt (dot matrix!), dismissing me with "You can use this to follow up [if you need to]." Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Consider Someplace Else”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Toilet ran all night long, bath towels were the roughest I've ever experienced, only 3 tissues left in the tissue box, carpet stains, alot of noise coming from other rooms after 11pm.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family had 5 rooms at this hotel for one night. One room was on one floor, 3 were on another, and the last was way up top. Being way spread out would have been OK until we got to the rooms. All 4 lower rooms were 80 degrees and above. We were assured that the rooms would be cool by the time we got back from our concert. After the concert we had to change 4 of the rooms twice trying to find cooler floors. We finally gave up at 12:30 a.m. with a room that was 77 degrees - still too warm. And the room did not even have a shower curtain! I understand they are going through renovations, but they need to either do it floor by floor and close that floor or close the entire hotel until finished. The only nice thing was the free shuttle to America West Arena.

Reviews.Title: “Administrative Issues”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Executive Park Hotel is an average place to stay (though a bit far from downtown) with a substandard management team. I've tried to obtain a receipt for my stay to replace one I lost and have been ignored. There's never anyone to talk to from management and phone calls/e mails receive no response. It's not a recipe for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Executive Hotel? - Not Executive Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Executive Park Hotel advertises it's amenities (none of which were operational during my 5 night stay) and proximity to the Civic center where my conference was being held. When I spoke with the hotel prior to booking, I was told that the hotel was a couple of blocks and within walking distance of the civic center. I walked it the first time and would never do it again. Not only was it more than a mile walk, but it was a walk through a less than desireable part of downtown. Therefore, I opted to pay unexpected taxi charges to guarantee my safety and state of mind. The room I stayed in and it's amenities was very nice. The hotel staff and restaurant/bar staff were great.... although the front desk was oddly unmanned upon my checkout (I waited about 15 min. then left to catch my flight). Strange Hugh???? In a nutshell, my stay was less than I expected by way of hotel amenities that I felt I paid for and very disappointing in locale. If I could have moved hotels mid conference...I would have.
